About MeI’m Tyler Spears, and I’m 20 years old. I go to Georgetown College in Scott County, where I’m majoring in Art and minoring in Computer Science. I’m really like graphic design and want to work in the design field or open my own print shop after college. I like to be creative and bring ideas to life.I’m also Adobe Illustrator certified, which has helped me in my design work. I enjoy learning new design techniques and exploring different creative styles.
Outside of school, I stay pretty active and social. I have played pickleball over the past few years and i have even won two tournaments. When I’m not playing pickleball i’m ussally playing viedo games or hanging out with my friends or my girlfriend if i’m not doing that then i’m most likly at work or school. I have three dogs named Sheba, Buddy and Cooper.
I have also done quite a bit of traveling across the U.S.. I’ve been to places like Yellowstone, Niagara Falls, and Florida, but my favorite trip so far was definitely Discovery Cove in Florida, where I got to swim with dolphins which has been an unforgettable experience.
I have also worked at Penn Station for about three years, and I’m currently a manager there. I handle most of the everyday operations, solve problems on the fly, and help train new team members. It’s taught me a lot about leadership, teamwork, and communication.
I’m proud to be an Eagle Scout and also completed NYLT (National Youth Leadership Training) through Boy Scouts, which helped me develop strong leadership and problem-solving skills that I carry into school, work, and everyday life.
Thank you for reading my get to know me if you care to learn more about other stuff i have done i have articles and links to the things i like.

Enhancement of site The Hugo theme that I decided to use is the Vortisil theme. The reason that I picked this theme was for two main reasons. Number one it is way simpler then that of the previous theme i was using which is blowfish. This site has a nice clean element to it that blowfish didn’t have and there are less moving parts. It was still difficult to set up and took some time to do so but after I got the hang of it the site setup became a lot easier. The second reason I like this theme is because it offers the option for dark mod which I just have a strange liking to and wish every site had that option. Other than those two things this site works similar to that of blowfish and other themes I have used. It uses CSS and HTML in order to style the page but this is where the actual enhancements come into play. The first thing that I decided to do was to make all the pages consistent. This is where I went into Canva and I started to make my own banners. The making of my own banners gave the site a more personal touch and not so much of a carbon copy site template. The next thing that I decided to do was add the main top navigation bar that allows users to move from one page topic to another. With that I also added the articles and the blogs to the home page. This for one makes the home page feel more filled with life but also allows the user to see recent blog posts and articles and topics like this one. I also wanted to make my blogs more fluid and feel like you can move between them easier so I added a back to blogs button at the top and I added a button that takes you back to the top of the page this allows for easier site navigation and for the users ease of use. The next thing I added was the use of categories that allows the user to now search categories by tags and types rather than going through the whole list. There also exists a search bar at the top of the main navigation that allows the user to type in certain words and find them in the blogs and articles. This allows the user to search for things particular to them so for instance if the user types in hamlet into the search it will bring up the blog that relates to that. Most of the enhancements were done by me and the structure and placement were as well but that doesn’t mean no AI was used for more information on this go to the other article page about AI or for ease of use click right HERE. This is most of the enhancements that I made to the site in order to make it function and to look good.
title: Enhancment of Site

content: The use of AI comes in very handy throughout the process of the site creation mostly in troubleshooting and fixing simple errors. Unfortunately I am broke and just use the free version of ChatGPT which you don’t have to log into so it doesn’t save any of your chat information but I’m here to tell you everything it did and what it helped me with. Starting off AI is a good and helpful tool for the use of site creation but at the same time I feel that it can harm the student who uses it if they rely on it too much. This is why I try to limit the use of AI and how much I depend on it. This being said, I still use AI to a good degree. I used ChatGPT to help me with all of the following things said below. First was getting the hugo site up in running. I tried a few different Hugo themes but could not seem to get any of them to work, which I found strange because I got the blowfish theme up and running a lot easier than the Vortisil theme that I currently have. So in my time of need trying to find a new theme that would work I went to ChatGPT. Unfortunately this even stumped AI for a little bit as I kept trying to get the site to work and it gave me advice and still nothing after a bit of doing this I would give up and move onto the next theme. AI doesnt know how to set up the hugo theme sites directly so it needs a lot of guidance in order to reach a functional site state after a while of trying on different themes i believe that i taught it enough that it finally got the theme to work. It wasn’t pretty and the site barely functioned but at least I wasn’t getting an error. This was just the beginning. After that I messed around with all the site settings, figured out what edited what and then finally began my process. For the most part the setup was not very hard and using the TOML front matter was very easy as it was similar to that of the blowfish theme. After the setup of the site in its most basic form i was trying to figure out how to get my pictures to work at the top of each site so i went to AI and asked it questions about how to do this luckily it did know how to do this pretty quick and only took a few tries to set up which was better then how long it took the site to get up. Luckily AI explains everything it does and how it achieved it which makes it a lot easier to understand and how to modify it later one thing it does do bad in this aspect is when it explains something but it doesnt get it right i know this probably has something to do with my guidance to the AI or the fact that i’m broke and using the free basic model of ChatGPT but sometimes this can throw me off of the right track and actually be a little harder. The next thing that happened is I asked ChatGPT to make me cards for my blogs and articles on the web page. This gave it a cleaner look and made it easier to read. I did edit the cards a little more to achieve the look I was going for but overall it helped make the cards. The next thing I used it for was maybe a mistake and took way too long but I do like the way it turned out and that was in the blog section trying to make the categories all their own buttons and for it to filter the blogs to only show those blogs with that tag was very hard to do. Luckily for me I have worked quite a bit with the HTML format so doing html code and CSS styling is nothing new to me but the part that was hard was getting the overall look I wanted while getting the javascript to work. Shame to say but I allowed AI to create the javascript to do this as I spent a bit trying to figure it out and couldn’t get it to work. On the other hand it took me an AI about an hour of back and forth to finally get a version that worked. The last thing that I used AI for was to add the back to blogs button at the top of the blogs and the scroll to top button that is in the bottom right corner the overall look and the button was done by me but i couldn’t get it to float to the right and stay on the page as you scrolled. This was the moment that I realized how different the code of this theme was to that of blowfish, the previous theme that I was using. The first main difference was that all of the style of the pages and how the index pages were layout was done by the layout category of the code i had to put all of the styling that i wanted done and the layout of all the home pages into this layout section i tried for a while to get the site to accept the _index.md and the index.md pages as the start to those pages but that didn’t work the only way to fix these was to put everything into the layout folder under the html that needed to be used in this. AI tipped me off on this and gave me a very good way to do this and to use all that code. Unfortunately this code differed from that of the code i am normally used to so i had to use AI in order to help me get the base layouts for some of the pages. The theme did come with the layout for the main page though so I copied off of it and used that to help me with the other pages as they were all fairly similar. By far the place that AI was the most helpful or at least helped me the most even if it did lead me astray was in the creation of the Hugo site and how to set up the theme and get it working without this tiny bit of guidance then the site would have not gotten done since i would have never been able to get it started or at least with an easier theme. AI is also good at doing code; it doesn’t always get it right but with enough guidance it tends to eventually get the answer. One way it falls short is it’s not good at making things, at least in the sense of getting it to do what you want it to do. For instance, I wanted the boxes to look a certain way and it was just not fully pulling it off. It would also sometimes try to edit code that already worked or go back to something that was already fine. This would be annoying especially when I think I have that part finished and then it wants to change it and I have to be like NO. As I said earlier, sometimes it leads you astray and doesn’t always get the answer right but it does try to correct its mistakes so as long as i don’t believe everything it says then it’s not too bad. Overall I think AI is a helpful and good learning tool but it can be used as a bad thing in order to cheat that whole process but as long as it is used for good and in some sort of moderation I think it is helpful.
title: The Use of AI

content:
There are many things I like to do in my everyday life but there is one thing I enjoy above all and that is playing video games. With the use of platforms like steam on the computer there are almost infinite games to play and that being said there is one game that i liked to play above the rest and that was rocket league. Back when i started playing rocket league it was a simple game that can be defined in just a few words “Car Soccer". The whole concept seemed odd at first. Why would I want to drive around a field chasing a ball to play soccer? That’s where it gets entertaining.
Rocket league used to be called supersonic acrobatic rocket powered battle cars or SARPBC for short this game didn’t have many things to do and was overall a simple idea to drive into the ball and put it in the net but that’s not what it became. Over the years rocket league has developed far beyond what even the developers thought it would become. With a simple name change and some upgraded graphics that when it became the staple it is today. The game was fun to me with this simple concept but that’s what was so good about it. Anyone could pick up the game and already know what needs to be done. There are no hard rules to learn and no set guideline of how to play. All you need to do is drive into the ball. This is when the game turned and people got better.
That’s when mechanics came into play. These are cool shots you can do while playing these games. This includes musty flicks which involve flicking the ball off of the car to get power. Flip resets which involves getting a reset or your flip back while having possession of the ball. There are so many more to name: pogos, ground pinch, kuxir pinch, brezzi flick and so much more but that’s just to name a few. Most of these mechanics are named for what they do like a ground pinch is literally pitching the ball between the floor and your car to get a lot of power and other mechanics are named based off of the person that found them. These come into play every game as each person tries to do them and doing one correctly can decide the fate of the game. The double jump originally rocket league cars could only do one jump but then the developers added a second jump this made most of the mechanics possible as it allowed the car to move in ways it never could prior. That’s when a major bug was found in order to reset your double jump and to get it back you had to land all four wheels back on the ground. This made it so you can get your jump back but also couldn’t use it infinitely. People discovered that if you land on the ball in a certain way you can actually reset this flip and get another one off this created so of the most powerful and new mechanics like the flip reset.
The game tries to be balanced by ranking each player by their skill level from bronze all the way to supersonic legend where everyone aims to be. Only the top .1% of players actually make it there. This separates players by skill level so that you go against people that are similar in rank to you this creates a semi balanced game as both sides should be similar but it creates a lot of different games as each players play style and skill differs quite a bit. Currently I’m a diamond 3 / champ 1 player but it has also been a minute since I last played so that rank can differ a little.
Finally the takeover this is when epic games the creator of fortnite took over rocket league in doing so when they bought it they made it free to play meaning anyone can download and play the game this made the influx of the player base skyrock and allowed for a lot of new diverse skills to enter the game but this also created a big problem… in making the game free they invited people to be smurfs this is when a player that was high skill level would make a second account and play the game but either play internally bad or play with one of their lower ranked friends this would be because either they couldn’t play rank with that friend because the ranks are too far apart or they just wanted to play lower level matches but you can see how this starts to become unfair now that making a new account was free and didn’t cost the user 20$ dollars and rebuy the game the players could make themselves seem worse and they end up just dominating the other team since the skill level is so off. The next thing that epic did was get rid of trading this made it so that players could no longer give each other items meaning that if you had something valuable and wanted to trade it for something you liked more you can no longer do that these things started to make the game less fun i could no longer trade cool items i got for something i wanted more and every game that you went into the opponents skill level was higher then they should be this made the game it is today and that’s fine with me. But it’s no longer my first picked game and after having over 1000 hours in the game it disappoints me a little.
title: What Rocket League Has Become
